perturbation.original_text: University represents that informed consent was required from all individual subjects prior to enrollment in the Program, and that the Program was approved by the Institutional Review Board of the University.
perturbation.changed_text: University represents that the Program was approved by the Institutional Review Board of the University.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the explicit requirement for informed consent violates ethical and legal standards for clinical research in the United States. The Common Rule (45 CFR 46) mandates informed consent for human subjects in research, and omitting this representation creates a legal risk for ArTara. The FDA also requires informed consent as a prerequisite for using clinical trial data in regulatory submissions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 45 CFR 46 (The Common Rule), FDA regulations regarding informed consent

perturbation.original_text: The insurance will identify University Indemnitees as additional insureds and will provide that the carrier will notify University in writing at least […***…] prior to cancellation, non-renewal, or material change in coverage. Should ArTara fail to obtain replacement insurance providing comparable coverage within such […***…] period, University will have the right to termination this Agreement effective as of the end of the […***…] period without notice or any additional cure period.
perturbation.changed_text: The insurance will identify University Indemnitees as additional insureds.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the requirement for the insurance carrier to notify the University of cancellation, non-renewal, or material change in coverage, along with the University's right to terminate the agreement if comparable replacement insurance isn't obtained, weakens the University's protection. This omission introduces a legal risk by failing to ensure continuous insurance coverage, which is a standard practice in agreements involving potential liabilities. Without this notification, the University may unknowingly be exposed to uncovered liabilities.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding duty of good faith and fair dealing, industry standards for risk management and insurance.

perturbation.original_text: The insurance will include coverage for product liability with a minimum of […***…] dollars ($[…***…]) per occurrence and [… ***…] dollars ($[…***…]) annual aggregate, coverage for contractual liability, clinical trials liability if any such trial is performed, bodily injury and property damage, including completed operations, personal injury, coverage for contractual employees, blanket contractual and products, and all other coverages standard for such policies. Such insurance will additionally include errors and omissions insurance with a minimum of […***…] dollars ($[…***…]) per occurrence.
perturbation.changed_text: The insurance will include coverage for product liability and other coverages standard for such policies.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the specified minimum coverage amounts for product liability and errors and omissions insurance weakens the University's financial protection. This omission introduces a legal risk because it fails to ensure adequate coverage for potential liabilities arising from the use of Program Data or the development of the Product. Without defined minimum coverage, the University may not be adequately compensated for significant damages, potentially violating the principle of adequate compensation for foreseeable damages.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding adequate compensation for damages, industry standards for insurance coverage in pharmaceutical agreements.
